author: mohamed.mahmoud.lsnet
title: Cultural Tourism - Beyond Borders
description: Traditional cultural tourism is always considered expensive for the majority of the world population. Its prone to unforeseen force majeures

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of the project is tourism with a fraction of the cost. With the undeniable inflation travel is becoming harder and harder and the Covid situation isn’t helping make it better. The proposers are trying to come up with a way to give the users experiences similar to the originals through creating models and having uses buy the virtual historical components and get royalties for every visitor to the location.
f6_assessments.q1: The team seems capable and knowledgeable as well as the covid situation keeping most poeple put. And the prices of travel shooting up its is a fun and different idea that resembles tourism of the mind
f6_assessments.q2: It shouldn’t be hard to audit when looking at number of tourists and return tourists also the number of purchases of the digital historical components

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers want to create the first cultural metaverse “KemiLand” which restores culture and earns profit through investment based on Cardano blockchain. There is a problem mentioned in the proposal that most people consider traditional culture tourism to be expensive. By clearly identifying the main problem, the team has come up with a solution and added exhaustive explanations of the value it will bring to the ecosystem, by bringing benefit for people who want to have cultural tourism but do not have opportunities to do so ( known as visitors) and for investors who want to earn profit from this field ( known as citizens). The goals of this proposal align with the challenge setting. I have read quite a few proposals now and I do not see any key items missing from this one. The proposal also includes that joyfulness is the key reason why KemiLand is unique compared to other digital restoration initiatives and I think the given explanations are quite convincing and fascinating. I have no concern about the proposal and I strongly believe that this project will impact the community greatly if it gets funded.
f6_assessments.q1: In terms of feasibility, I have nothing but praise for the team. Each point is addressed in detail. The project is led by a committed team with much experience in multiple knowledge areas, which is necessary and will bring the project to its advance. There are reference links to verify the information. The time frame is solid and the team also gives detailed explanations for each stage of their project, which is very good. There is a sensible budget breakdown but I suggest that some more detail should be included. For example, what kind of promotion method would be taken? and what is included in “management”? It’s not very clear what it means here. However, I think that the proposal still deverse a 5 for feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: There are clear time-framed KPIs with targets which help to evaluate the progress as it evolves and have a reference whether the success is achieved or not. Some milestones can also be extracted from the timeline proposed. The indications for success are also relevant and align with the challenge. But will the development of the progress be updated on the website provided or any other social platform since I do not see any mention of it.
f6_assessments.reply: Wow,  thanks for such deep understanding.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal not only addresses the issue effectively, but it also takes it to a whole new level. Most people are afraid of blockchain technology because it is difficult to grasp, overly technical, and overwhelming. Removing this aspect of blockchain technology while maximizing user experience is exactly the type of action that will accelerate mass adoption. I believe there is significant value in providing a metaverse model of civilization restoration that can assist cultural tourists in learning, discovering, and experiencing a civilization. This proposal is extremely beneficial to the Carnado ecosystem. It is a plus point since the proposer presented some remarkable benefits for the Carnado community. The Egypt concept is a good idea. The proposers may be introducing a paradigm shift for the cultural tourism industry by developing a tool that allows non-developers (visitors and citizens) to leverage what the blockchain offers (secure, self-sovereign data) via a web-based application.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal outlines exactly what has to be done at each milestone, as well as the timeframes and deliverables for each step. The deliverables are all appropriate for the solution's development. The team then divides the budget into five distinct components and it is reasonable in order to meet the established goals. They did an excellent job in terms of budget description, as well as identifying future risks that could jeopardize a successful implementation. Team members have managed to assemble a very diverse set of skills and experience across a wide range of disciplines. Referrals on LinkedIn were provided, so experience can be verified from that perspective. Because a large portion of the budget is allocated to promotion, groundwork, and research, it is difficult to determine whether the values are reasonable because they are heavily influenced by the local context. There is a timeline that presents the details of the actions that will be carried out, which I find to be reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2: In terms of auditability, the team delivered outstanding results. There has been a clear explanation of the key milestones, indicating two milestones with brief descriptions, so that the community understands both what will happen and when it will happen. The success criteria are appropriate and relevant for the next round of funding; however, the suggested metrics are difficult to measure in my opinion. To avoid confusion among future proposers, I recommend, if possible, reviewing the metrics prior to the launch. I agree that the success criteria and suggested metrics are appropriately set to track progress in addressing the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0:
The team wants to build a civilisation restoration app (or metaverse as they name it), named KemiLand, starting first with the ancient Egyptian civilisation. It could be a way to provide the opportunity for everyone, regardless of budget, to be able to digitally visit (with the help of AR and VR) and discover the monuments and possible way of life of the ancient Egyptians.
While the idea is good, and has been proven viable through multiple AAA games, that having ancient cultural monuments or entire cities (see “Assassin's Creed Origins” as an example that first comes to mind) as a basis for exploration and learning; I find that the entire endeavour could work better in a different challenge, either Dapps and Integrations or possibly even Gamers On-Chained.
The end goal of the proposal does not provide any type of business solutions, it is an app development for a specific use for a single company, coupled with an NFT launch, and as such I suggest to the proposers to resubmit the idea in a future fund either in a different challenge or with additional information that can connect it to this one.
f6_assessments.q1:
The detailed plan and timeline are comprehensive, and even though the proposers warn us that the roadmap is a work in progress, the details that have been provided are sufficient for assessment. 
Regarding the budget, however, the provided information is not sufficient. For example, “Awareness Campaign” is stated to need $15000 but it is unclear what exactly the budget is for, as there are no additional details about it. How and where, how many people will be involved in it? How did the proposers come up with that specific amount? If this information is not provided, I cannot assess whether the amount is realistic and feasible and if the proposers will be able to accomplish their plans.
The proposers have provided the necessary info regarding the team, social links for verification, but because the budget section is incomplete, I cannot assess the success in the implementation of the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The provided progress measurement is very detailed and divided in two phases: “For Restoration cycle” and “For the complete project”, each with corresponding KPIs.
The success description is well detailed, as well, offers ample indicators for success for some of the steps (“The number of visitors to KemiLand reaches 40 millions annually”), and as such I find no detail lacking in the assessment of the progress and positive outcome of the proposal.
f6_assessments.reply:
Our flag is only for Impact assessment. 
It seems the assessor is not aware of business opportunities in a typical metaverse which can be easily found with a simple google search. I found this URL https://101blockchains.com/business-opportunities-in-metaverse/ which can be used to understand the business opportunities behind typical metaverses. 

We stated very clear in our proposal why we picked F8: Business Solutions (B2B & B2C)

Why placing a metaverse proposal in B2B and B2C challenge?
“KemiLand is not a game or typical social metaverse, Its a paradigm shift for the cultural tourism industry. It's a completely new business model that will disturb counterpart traditional business model. We picked the business solution challenge to place our proposal as KemiLand is a business opportunity for both B2B and B2C and the B2B and B2C challenge is considering metaverses as proposal”.

KemiLand extends the typical metaverse business opportunities with its unique Visitor/Citizen model 
which will allow:
Small businesses (Bars, Coffeeshop, gaming centers, Culture Centers, etc)and even individuals becoming ambassadors and issuing KemiLand tickets for KemiLand visitors as KemiLand will be only accessible to visitors via our ambassadors. Please check the proposal for more details.

f6_assessments.q0: Metaverse is the general trend of 4.0 technology which is the inevitable development of the new technology era. Many companies and technology corporations are ready to invest in this direction. This is a proposal of metaverse in the field of travel, renaissance on metaverse (virtual image) of past cultures and civilizations. If there are projects like this successful, just by watching a movie with lifelike metaverse technology will help viewers extremely interested, easy to remember information about culture and history. So I highly recommend projects like this on our cardano platform. This also promotes the payment of metaverse services in digital currency.
f6_assessments.q1: This is the team plan outlined in the first 3 months of work, a completely new proposal. Their focus is on planning and researching tourist destinations to experiment with metaverse technology. At the same time, gather qualified members to implement the project. I find their plan quite reasonable, the expenses are moderate. In addition, they have a team of recognized technical and financial experts with many years of experience. These are the factors that show the feasibility of this project.
f6_assessments.q2: They have a detailed plan and have metrics that show the progress of the work through: the number of people reaching out from the community, the local travel agencies can incorporate the implementation of the metaverse service. Promote tourist awareness through visual literacy education through the metaverse. Verification through videos and photos provided at tourist sites and allowing the community to verify information is the most convincing way to show that real progress has been made.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a great proposal that focuses on creating the first cultural metaverse “KemiLand”, where culture restoration and investment are together based on the Cardano blockchain.
Regarding impact, some issues that should be noted are as follow:
First, the proposer defines a suitable problem within the challenge which needs to be solved, explains it in detail with rationale. He/she demonstrates a certain deep understanding of the field they is discussing. The problem raised shows the authenticity and urgency to be solved in order to achieve the goals of the challenge in particular and the entire ecosystem in general. In addition, the proposed solution is clearly defined. It shows the possibility of adding value to the Cardano ecosystem with a clear expected impact in short term and long term. Besides, the proposer also defines the possibility of scaling to address future challenges. In short, taking advantage of the power and advantages of blockchain technology to serve the purpose of restoring and preserving cultural and historical heritage architectures will bring many meanings and far-reaching impacts. This proposal not only shows the great meanings that can be brought but also demonstrates a clear business model as well as the potential brought to the Cardano ecosystem from this business model.
In conclusion, I strongly agree with the impact of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
Regarding the feasibility, there are some issues that should be noted, including:
First of all, this team is made up of members with expertise and experience in the field of information technology, digital space simulation technology, and their profile is clearly described, show suitable skill, experiences for implementation, with proof for verifying. In addition, the proposer provided information that shows their demo/prototype. This proposal's goal is clear and supported by convincing reasons, along with a specific roadmap, some logical, measurable KPIs/metrics realistic, and a budget breakdown for the detail of the implementation process. The risk is clearly defined, this shows that the proposer has fully looked at what could happen during the implementation of this proposal, however, there is not any mitigation supplied.
Therefore, based on the provided information, I strongly agree with this proposal's feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are a few points to consider when it comes to the auditability of this plan, including:
First and foremost, this team profile is well-defined, with evidence for backing it up. Second, the roadmap is sufficiently explained for comprehension. The proposer(s) choose some quantitative KPI/metrics to assess the proposal's success. This proposal included a total budget with an easy-to-understand item structure, but no explanation of the calculation basis [number of workers, working hours, labor price, etc.].
Based on the evidence supplied, I strongly support the auditability of this plan.

f6_assessments.q0:
Breaking cultural boundries and become a global citizen is a fundamental need for building on Cardano. The Team here describes a unique adventure of building various cultural/historical sites online to allow the world to see the true feeling and comunity build at its true form. This will allow people of all ages and financial capabilities to "travel" virtually and explore sites. The group will start its first culture in ancient Egypt and will then grow to multiple global cultural location. 
This can become a learning and adventurous locations for people to interact showcase their own lifestyle and share their best image to the world. 
In a time where the global media is pushing their narrative onto the mainstream I feel this is a unique tool for the underepresented to have a loud voice and stage.
f6_assessments.q1:
As this project is large the team has published their website and is in the phase of reserching their firs cultural site (ancient egypt). 
They have a 3 month period for each restoration cycle that they wish to continously release new cultural sites with. 
Finally the technical experience of the group is vast from historical, programing, economic and marketing. I feel the team is solid to cover all bases. 
The only risk for this project is to onboard the first group of users/ land owner. 
This risk is addressed in detail by the minting of the first restorative cycle and giving land owner DAO voting rights and sharing profits from the tokenomics. 
Overall the project is deemed to raise interest in a world that is constantly growing and need for connecting one another in a virtual way.
f6_assessments.q2:
Kemiland and the idea owners are proposing to have multiple onboarding campaigns. The KPIs are based on the success and growth of the overall project. As well as creating the minting and first round of restoration cycle for the ancient egyptian lands. 
I woudl recommend as well to describe the social network metrics needed to raise awareness and to publish the roadmap on their website to allow for traceability

solution: Create the first cultural metaverse “KemiLand”,where culture restoration and investment are together  based on Cardano blockchain
experience: Since our establishment in 2012, PTS has emerged as a main provider of managed services, project management, technology solutions provider and digital transformation enabler . In 2022, we have a strategic direction to build and manage secure and valuable investment.
